Class ShipLayout

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsoftware.ll13.model.ship_board.ship_components.ShipLayout
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ShipLayout extends Object implements Serializable
This class manages the logic to add tiles, remove tiles, and handles the validation part too
See Also:

    • getTopCell

      @Contract(pure=true) @Nullable public @Nullable ShipCell getTopCell(int row, int col)
      This method returns the cell above the given row and column in the ship's matrix (motherBoard), or null if the specified cell is in the first row (i.e., there is no cell above it).
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the current cell.
      col - the column index of the current cell.
      Returns:
      the ShipCell directly above the given cell, or null if there is no cell above it.

    • getRightCell

      @Contract(pure=true) @Nullable public @Nullable ShipCell getRightCell(int row, int col)
      This method returns the cell to the right of the given row and column in the ship's matrix (motherBoard), or null if the specified cell is in the last column (i.e., there is no cell to the right).
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the current cell.
      col - the column index of the current cell.
      Returns:
      the ShipCell directly to the right of the given cell, or null if there is no cell to the right.

    • getBottomCell

      @Contract(pure=true) @Nullable public @Nullable ShipCell getBottomCell(int row, int col)
      This method returns the cell directly below the given row and column in the ship's matrix (motherBoard), or null if the specified cell is in the last row (i.e., there is no cell below).
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the current cell.
      col - the column index of the current cell.
      Returns:
      the ShipCell directly below the given cell, or null if there is no cell below.

      Parameters:

      col - the column index of the current cell.

    • setWasteTiles

      public void setWasteTiles(int wasteTiles)

    • hasValidPathToCenter

      public boolean hasValidPathToCenter(int startRow, int startCol)
      Checks if there is a valid path from a given starting cell to the center of the ship. A valid path means that the cells are connected via valid connections and each cell is occupied and valid according to the ship's design rules.

      The method performs a breadth-first search (BFS) starting from the given coordinates. It checks if there is a valid path to the center (CENTRAL_ROW, CENTRAL_COL) following the connections between adjacent tiles (based on the connector types).

      Parameters:
      startRow - the row index of the starting cell.
      startCol - the column index of the starting cell.
      Returns:
      true if there is a valid path to the center; false otherwise.

    • invalidateCell

      public void invalidateCell(@NotNull @NotNull ShipCell shipCell) throws InvalidCellException
      Invalidates a given ShipCell and adds it to the invalidCells list. If the cell is already invalid or empty, no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      shipCell - the ShipCell to invalidate.
      Throws:
      InvalidCellException - if the shipCell is empty.

    • addTile

      public boolean addTile(Tile tile, int row, int col)
      The method calls the setter for insert a specific tile into the cell of the ship
      Parameters:
      tile - is the tile to insert
      row - represent the first index of the matrix
      col - represent the second index of the matrix
      Returns:
      true if tile has been added, false otherwise

    • drawTileFromTempZone

      public Tile drawTileFromTempZone(int tempRow, int tempCol)
      Method used to retrieve the tile present in the temp zone and send it back to who asked for it
      Parameters:
      tempRow - The Row of the temp cell
      tempCol - The Col of the temp cell
      Returns:
      the Tile to be returned

    • checkCannon

      public boolean checkCannon(@NotNull @NotNull CannonBaseTile cannonTile, int row, int col)
      This method checks if a cannon tile's target cell is empty or invalid. A cannon should not have a tile in the direction it is pointing to. If the target cell in the direction of the cannon is either empty or invalid, the cannon is considered valid.
      Parameters:
      cannonTile - the cannon tile to check.
      row - the row of the cannon tile in the ship's grid.
      col - the column of the cannon tile in the ship's grid.
      Returns:
      true if the target cell is empty or invalid (i.e., the cannon is valid), false otherwise.

    • checkConnections

      public boolean checkConnections() throws InvalidCellException
      This method checks all the connections of the tiles in the ship and validates if they follow the correct connection rules. It checks each tile in the ship and its adjacent tiles to ensure that their connections are valid based on their connector types (i.e., SMOOTH, UNIVERSAL, SINGLE, DOUBLE). If any invalid connection is found, the method invalidates the corresponding cells.
      Returns:
      true if all the connections are valid, false if there is at least one invalid connection.
      Throws:
      InvalidCellException - if there is an issue with a cell during validation.

    • isValidShip

      public boolean isValidShip() throws InvalidCellException
      This method checks if the ship is valid by verifying the connections between tiles, and ensuring that the motor and cannon rules are respected. If any invalid cells are found (whether due to improper connections or invalid motors/cannons), those cells are marked as invalid and the method will return false.

      note that cannonTile is invalid if it is not pointing to the BOTTOM of the ship,or if it has a tile in the cell towards which he is pointing

      Returns:
      true if the ship is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      InvalidCellException - if an issue occurs during the validation of a cell.

    • eliminateTile

      public void eliminateTile(int row, int col)
      Eliminates the tile at the specified coordinates, invalidates the corresponding cell, and propagates the invalidation to adjacent cells if necessary.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the tile to be eliminated.
      col - The column index of the tile to be eliminated.
